_metadata.description: GDD (Growing Degree Day) base temperature assumptions for crops

confidence_levels.high: Direct citation from university extension or peer-reviewed research
confidence_levels.medium: Inferred from crop family or similar crops with documented values
confidence_levels.low: General cool/warm season classification, limited specific research

crop_alexanders.name: Alexanders
crop_alexanders.notes: Apiaceae family (same as celery, parsley). Cool-season biennial herb. Inferred from Apiaceae family (parsley research - Elnesr 2013).
crop_alexanders.source: Inferred from Apiaceae family - cool-season base temp

crop_amaranth.name: Amaranth
crop_amaranth.notes: Pseudocereal. Research: Tbase 7°C, Tupper 30-40°C (using 35°C). Amaranthaceae family.
crop_amaranth.source: Paredes et al. 2025 (ScienceDirect); Bello and Walker (2017)

crop_anise-hysopp.name: Anise Hyssop
crop_anise-hysopp.notes: Lamiaceae family perennial herb. Cold-hardy. Inferred from cool Lamiaceae (oregano research - Thanos 1995).

crop_artichoke.name: Artichoke
crop_artichoke.notes: Cool-season perennial. Requires vernalization. Prefers 15-24°C growing temps. ROUGH ESTIMATE: 35°C upper based on warm-season classification.
crop_artichoke.source: UC Davis Extension, general cool-season classification

crop_arugula.name: Arugula
crop_arugula.notes: Cool-season leafy green. Thrives 7-16°C. Bolts in heat. Inferred from brassica family (kale/B. oleracea research).
crop_arugula.source: Research on leafy greens uses 4°C base; OSU Extension

crop_asian-greens.name: Asian Greens
crop_asian-greens.notes: Cool-season brassicas. Research uses 4°C base for Asian greens GDD calculations. Inferred from brassica family (kale/B. oleracea research).
crop_asian-greens.source: ResearchGate study on Asian greens, lettuce, spinach in high tunnels

crop_atriplex.name: Atriplex (Orache)
crop_atriplex.notes: Amaranthaceae family. Cool-season spinach-like green. Inferred from cool Amaranthaceae (beet/spinach research).
crop_atriplex.source: Inferred from cool-season leafy green classification

crop_bachellors-button.name: Bachelor's Button (Cornflower)
crop_bachellors-button.notes: Cool-season annual flower. Self-sows. Frost tolerant. ROUGH ESTIMATE: 30°C upper based on cool-season classification.

crop_basil.name: Basil
crop_basil.notes: Warm-season herb. Research: Tbase 10°C, Tupper 40°C. Optimal germination 25-30°C.
crop_basil.source: Paredes et al. 2025 (ScienceDirect); Teles et al. (2023)

crop_bean.name: Bean (Snap)
crop_bean.notes: Warm-season legume. Research: Tbase 9-10°C, Tupper 30-35°C for Phaseolus vulgaris. Note: OSU Croptime uses 4.4°C but peer-reviewed research suggests 10°C.
crop_bean.source: Paredes et al. 2025 (ScienceDirect); Espadafor et al. (2017); OSU Croptime differs

crop_beet.name: Beet
crop_beet.notes: Cool-season root crop. NDSU sugarbeet research: base 1.1°C (34°F), upper 30°C (86°F).
crop_beet.source: NDSU - Holen 1998, Holen & Dexter 1997 sugarbeet research

crop_bok-choy.name: Bok Choy
crop_bok-choy.notes: Cool-season brassica. Same as Asian greens - 4°C base. Inferred from brassica family (kale/B. oleracea research).
crop_bok-choy.source: Research on Asian greens GDD; brassica family classification

crop_borage.name: Borage
crop_borage.notes: Cool-season annual herb. Frost tolerant once established. ROUGH ESTIMATE: 30°C upper based on cool-season classification.

crop_broccoli.name: Broccoli
crop_broccoli.notes: OSU Croptime: 0°C lower, 21°C upper. Research confirms Tbase 0°C, Topt 20°C.
crop_broccoli.source: OSU Extension Croptime; ResearchGate peer-reviewed research

crop_brussel-sprouts.name: Brussels Sprouts
crop_brussel-sprouts.notes: Cool-season brassica. Very cold-hardy. Similar to other cole crops.
crop_brussel-sprouts.source: WISC Extension - cole crops use 4.4°C base

crop_buckwheat.name: Buckwheat
crop_buckwheat.notes: Cool-season pseudocereal. Fast-growing cover crop. ROUGH ESTIMATE: 30°C upper based on cool-season classification.

crop_bupleurum.name: Bupleurum
crop_bupleurum.notes: Apiaceae family cut flower. Cool-season. Inferred from Apiaceae family (parsley research - Elnesr 2013).

crop_butterfly-flowers.name: Butterfly Flowers
crop_butterfly-flowers.notes: Likely refers to Asclepias or similar. Warm-season perennial. ROUGH ESTIMATE: 35°C upper based on warm-season classification.

crop_cabbage.name: Cabbage
crop_cabbage.notes: Cool-season brassica. Cole crops use 4.4°C base. Tolerates frost.

crop_carrot.name: Carrot
crop_carrot.notes: Cool-season Apiaceae. Research: similar to parsley (Apiaceae family) with Tupper around 27°C.
crop_carrot.source: WIKI (Gilmore & Rogers 1958); Apiaceae family - parsley upper from Elnesr et al. (2013)

crop_catnip.name: Catnip
crop_catnip.notes: Lamiaceae family perennial. Cold-hardy to zone 3. Inferred from cool Lamiaceae (oregano research - Thanos 1995).
crop_catnip.source: Inferred from cold-hardy perennial herb classification

crop_cauliflower.name: Cauliflower
crop_cauliflower.notes: Cool-season brassica. Temperature-sensitive for curd development. Ideal 20-26°C.
crop_cauliflower.source: WISC Extension; MSU Extension - cole crop classification

crop_celery.name: Celery
crop_celery.notes: Cool-season Apiaceae. Research: similar to parsley (Apiaceae family) with Tupper around 27°C.
crop_celery.source: Apiaceae family classification; parsley upper from Elnesr et al. (2013)

crop_celery-root.name: Celery Root (Celeriac)
crop_celery-root.notes: Cool-season Apiaceae. Same as celery family, Tupper ~27°C.
crop_celery-root.source: Apiaceae family classification; parsley upper from Elnesr et al. (2013)

crop_celosia.name: Celosia
crop_celosia.notes: Warm-season annual flower. Frost-sensitive. Amaranthaceae family. Inferred from warm Amaranthaceae (amaranth research).

crop_chervil.name: Chervil
crop_chervil.notes: Cool-season Apiaceae herb. Bolts quickly in heat. Prefers shade. Inferred from Apiaceae family (parsley research - Elnesr 2013).
crop_chervil.source: Inferred from Apiaceae cool-season herb classification

crop_chicory.name: Chicory
crop_chicory.notes: Cool-season Asteraceae. Related to lettuce. Cold-tolerant. Inferred from Asteraceae family (lettuce research).
crop_chicory.source: Inferred from lettuce family, cool-season classification

crop_chijimisai.name: Chijimisai
crop_chijimisai.notes: Japanese mustard green (Brassica rapa). Cool-season Asian brassica. Inferred from brassica family (kale/B. oleracea research).
crop_chijimisai.source: Asian greens research; brassica family classification

crop_choi-sum.name: Choi Sum
crop_choi-sum.notes: Brassica rapa. Cool-season Asian green. Same as bok choy family. Inferred from brassica family (kale/B. oleracea research).

crop_chrysanthemum.name: Chrysanthemum
crop_chrysanthemum.notes: Cool-season Asteraceae. Short-day flowering. Cold tolerant. Inferred from Asteraceae family (lettuce research).

crop_chrysanthemum-greens.name: Chrysanthemum Greens (Shungiku)
crop_chrysanthemum-greens.notes: Cool-season Asteraceae edible green. Bolts in heat. Inferred from Asteraceae family (lettuce research).
crop_chrysanthemum-greens.source: Inferred from cool-season Asian green classification

crop_cilantro.name: Cilantro
crop_cilantro.notes: Cool-season Apiaceae. Research: Tbase 4-4.8°C, Tupper 30°C for Coriandrum sativum. Bolts readily in heat.

crop_clematis.name: Clematis
crop_clematis.notes: Perennial vine. Deciduous. Cold-hardy. ROUGH ESTIMATE: 30°C upper based on cool-season classification.

crop_collard-greens.name: Collard Greens
crop_collard-greens.notes: Cool-season brassica. Most cold-hardy of cole crops. Heat tolerant too. Inferred from brassica family (kale/B. oleracea research).

crop_corn.name: Corn (Sweet)
crop_corn.source: OSU Extension Croptime; MSU Extension; NDSU; multiple sources

crop_corn-salad.name: Corn Salad (Mâche)
crop_corn-salad.notes: Very cold-hardy leafy green. Grows at near-freezing temps. ROUGH ESTIMATE: 30°C upper based on cool-season classification.

crop_cosmos.name: Cosmos
crop_cosmos.notes: Warm-season annual flower. Frost-sensitive. Mexican origin. ROUGH ESTIMATE: 35°C upper based on warm-season classification.
crop_cosmos.source: Inferred from warm-season origin; no specific GDD research found

crop_cress.name: Cress
crop_cress.notes: Cool-season Brassicaceae. Fast-growing. Bolts in heat. Inferred from brassica family (kale/B. oleracea research).
crop_cress.source: Inferred from brassica family cool-season classification

crop_cucumber.name: Cucumber
crop_cucumber.source: OSU Extension Croptime vegetable degree-day models

crop_dahlia.name: Dahlia
crop_dahlia.notes: Warm-season tuber. Plant when soil above 15°C. No frost tolerance. ROUGH ESTIMATE: 35°C upper based on warm-season classification.
crop_dahlia.source: Multiple extension sources cite 15°C soil minimum

crop_dianthus.name: Dianthus
crop_dianthus.notes: Cool-season flower. Many species very cold-hardy. ROUGH ESTIMATE: 30°C upper based on cool-season classification.

crop_dill.name: Dill
crop_dill.notes: Cool-season Apiaceae. Same family as parsley/cilantro. Tupper ~27°C.
crop_dill.source: Apiaceae family classification; parsley upper from Elnesr et al. (2013)

crop_dropmore.name: Dropmore
crop_dropmore.notes: Likely honeysuckle vine. Cold-hardy perennial. ROUGH ESTIMATE: 30°C upper based on cool-season classification.

crop_eggplant.name: Eggplant
crop_eggplant.notes: Warm-season Solanaceae. Research: Tbase 15.6°C (Maynard & Hochmuth 2007). Growth inhibited above 32°C.
crop_eggplant.source: Colombian eggplant GDD research; BMC Plant Biology temperature stress studies

crop_epazote.name: Epazote
crop_epazote.notes: Warm-season Amaranthaceae herb. Mexican origin. Inferred from warm Amaranthaceae (amaranth research).
crop_epazote.source: Inferred from warm-season tropical herb classification

crop_everlasting.name: Everlasting (Strawflower family)
crop_everlasting.notes: Warm-season annual flowers. Australian origin species. ROUGH ESTIMATE: 35°C upper based on warm-season classification.

crop_fava-bean.name: Fava Bean
crop_fava-bean.notes: Cool-season legume. Research: base 4°C, ~1600 GDD to maturity. Upper ~30°C.
crop_fava-bean.source: ResearchGate faba bean GDD research; Field Crop News

crop_fennel.name: Fennel
crop_fennel.notes: Cool-season Apiaceae. Same family as parsley. Tupper ~27°C from family research.
crop_fennel.source: Apiaceae family classification; parsley upper from Elnesr et al. (2013)

crop_flax.name: Flax
crop_flax.notes: Cool-season fiber crop. Research: Tbase 0-5°C (using 3°C midpoint). No upper documented. ROUGH ESTIMATE: 30°C upper based on cool-season classification.
crop_flax.source: Paredes et al. 2025 (ScienceDirect); Fresco et al. (2021)

crop_frise.name: Frisée
crop_frise.notes: Cool-season chicory/endive. Related to lettuce. Same as chicory family. Inferred from Asteraceae family (lettuce research).

crop_garlic.name: Garlic
crop_garlic.notes: Cool-season allium. Requires vernalization. Growth near 0°C. Heat stress above 27°C reduces yield.
crop_garlic.source: Biology Open garlic temperature research; allium thermal studies

crop_ginger.name: Ginger
crop_ginger.notes: Tropical crop. Needs soil 13°C+. Optimal 20-25°C. No frost tolerance. ROUGH ESTIMATE: 35°C upper based on warm-season classification.
crop_ginger.source: Extension sources consistent on 10-13°C minimum; tropical origin

crop_gooseberry.name: Gooseberry
crop_gooseberry.notes: Cold-hardy perennial fruit. Northern climate origin. Inferred from temperate berry (strawberry/raspberry research).

crop_grass.name: Grass (Ornamental)
crop_grass.notes: Varies by species. Cool-season grasses use ~4°C base. ROUGH ESTIMATE: 30°C upper based on cool-season classification.

crop_ground-cherry.name: Ground Cherry
crop_ground-cherry.notes: Warm-season Solanaceae. Same family as tomatillo. Flowers abort below 13°C or above 32°C.

crop_hibiscus.name: Hibiscus
crop_hibiscus.notes: Warm-season Malvaceae. Tropical/subtropical origin. ROUGH ESTIMATE: 35°C upper based on warm-season classification.

crop_hops-vine-with-flowers.name: Hops
crop_hops-vine-with-flowers.notes: Cool-season perennial. Research: Tbase 5°C for Humulus lupulus. No upper documented. ROUGH ESTIMATE: 30°C upper based on cool-season classification.
crop_hops-vine-with-flowers.source: Paredes et al. 2025 (ScienceDirect); Srečec et al. (2008)

crop_huauzontle.name: Huauzontle
crop_huauzontle.notes: Chenopodium - related to quinoa/lambsquarters. Warm-season. Inferred from warm Amaranthaceae (amaranth research).

crop_hyacinth-bean-vine.name: Hyacinth Bean
crop_hyacinth-bean-vine.notes: Warm-season tropical legume vine. No frost tolerance. Inferred from warm legume family (bean research).

crop_hydrangea.name: Hydrangea
crop_hydrangea.notes: Cold-hardy deciduous shrub. Temperate origin. ROUGH ESTIMATE: 30°C upper based on cool-season classification.

crop_jelly-melon.name: Jelly Melon (Kiwano)
crop_jelly-melon.notes: Warm-season cucurbit (Cucumis metuliferus). African origin. Inferred from cucurbit family (squash research).

crop_kaibroc.name: Kaibroc
crop_kaibroc.notes: Brassica hybrid (broccoli x kale). Cool-season. Inferred from brassica family (kale/B. oleracea research).

crop_kale.name: Kale
crop_kale.notes: Cool-season brassica. Research: B. oleracea growth seriously compromised above 32°C.
crop_kale.source: WISC Extension; BMC Plant Biology B. oleracea temperature stress research

crop_kohlrabi.name: Kohlrabi
crop_kohlrabi.notes: Cool-season brassica. Best at 16-18°C. Cole crop family. Inferred from brassica family (kale/B. oleracea research).

crop_komatsuna.name: Komatsuna
crop_komatsuna.notes: Japanese mustard spinach (Brassica rapa). Cool-season Asian green. Inferred from brassica family (kale/B. oleracea research).

crop_leek.name: Leek
crop_leek.notes: Cool-season allium. Very cold-hardy. Matures best below 24°C. Inferred from allium family (onion research).
crop_leek.source: Allium research; same as onion/garlic family

crop_lemon-balm.name: Lemon Balm
crop_lemon-balm.notes: Warm-season crop. Research: Tbase 7.2°C, Tupper 40°C for Melissa officinalis (germination focused).
crop_lemon-balm.source: Paredes et al. 2025 (ScienceDirect); Atashi et al. (2014)

crop_lemongrass.name: Lemongrass
crop_lemongrass.notes: Tropical grass. No frost tolerance. Needs warm soil. ROUGH ESTIMATE: 35°C upper based on warm-season classification.

crop_lettuce.name: Lettuce
crop_lettuce.notes: Cool-season. Base 4.5°C (Gilmore & Rogers 1958). Research: upper ~30-35°C, bolts in heat.
crop_lettuce.source: WIKI (Gilmore & Rogers 1958); ScienceDirect thermal threshold review

crop_lilies.name: Lilies
crop_lilies.notes: Cold-hardy bulb. Most species require vernalization. ROUGH ESTIMATE: 30°C upper based on cool-season classification.

crop_lovage.name: Lovage
crop_lovage.notes: Cold-hardy Apiaceae perennial. Same family as celery. Inferred from Apiaceae family (parsley research - Elnesr 2013).

crop_magenta-spreen.name: Magenta Spreen
crop_magenta-spreen.notes: Chenopodium (lambsquarters family). Cool-season edible weed. Inferred from cool Amaranthaceae (beet/spinach research).

crop_malabar-spinach.name: Malabar Spinach
crop_malabar-spinach.notes: Tropical vine. Needs warm temps. Not true spinach. ROUGH ESTIMATE: 35°C upper based on warm-season classification.

crop_marigolds.name: Marigolds
crop_marigolds.notes: Warm-season annual. Mexican origin. Frost-sensitive. ROUGH ESTIMATE: 35°C upper based on warm-season classification.

crop_marjoram.name: Marjoram
crop_marjoram.notes: Warm-season Lamiaceae herb. Less cold-hardy than oregano. Inferred from warm Lamiaceae (basil research - Teles 2023).

crop_melon.name: Melon
crop_melon.notes: Warm-season cucurbit. Research: base 9.4°C, optimum 27.3°C, ceiling 41.4°C. ~1850 GDD to maturity.

crop_microgreens.name: Microgreens
crop_microgreens.notes: Varies by species. Most are cool-season brassica/leafy greens. Inferred from brassica family (kale/B. oleracea research).

crop_milkweed.name: Milkweed
crop_milkweed.notes: Native perennial. Warm-season growth. Some species cold-hardy. ROUGH ESTIMATE: 35°C upper based on warm-season classification.
crop_milkweed.source: Inferred from warm-season native plant classification

crop_mint.name: Mint
crop_mint.notes: Cool-season crop. Research: Tbase 0°C, Tupper 35°C for Mentha spicata.
crop_mint.source: Paredes et al. 2025 (ScienceDirect); Allen et al. (2020)

crop_mock-orange.name: Mock Orange
crop_mock-orange.notes: Cold-hardy deciduous shrub. Temperate origin. ROUGH ESTIMATE: 30°C upper based on cool-season classification.

crop_mustard-greens.name: Mustard Greens
crop_mustard-greens.notes: Cool-season brassica. Cold-tolerant. Bolts in heat. Inferred from brassica family (kale/B. oleracea research).
crop_mustard-greens.source: Brassica family classification; Asian greens research

crop_nausturtium.name: Nasturtium
crop_nausturtium.notes: Warm-season annual. Frost-sensitive. Andean origin. ROUGH ESTIMATE: 35°C upper based on warm-season classification.

crop_nigella.name: Nigella
crop_nigella.notes: Cool-season annual flower. Self-sows. Cold-tolerant. ROUGH ESTIMATE: 30°C upper based on cool-season classification.

crop_onion.name: Onion
crop_onion.notes: Cool-season allium. Research: Tbase 0.2-0.3°C, ceiling 35-42°C (varies by cultivar). Day-length sensitive.
crop_onion.source: ResearchGate thermal-time analysis; New Phytologist hydrothermal threshold models

crop_oregano.name: Oregano
crop_oregano.notes: Cool-season crop. Research: Tbase ~5°C, Tupper 30°C for Origanum vulgare.
crop_oregano.source: Paredes et al. 2025 (ScienceDirect); Thanos et al. (1995)

crop_pansy-and-violas.name: Pansy and Violas
crop_pansy-and-violas.notes: Very cold-hardy cool-season flowers. Grow near freezing. ROUGH ESTIMATE: 30°C upper based on cool-season classification.

crop_parsley.name: Parsley
crop_parsley.notes: Cool-season Apiaceae. Research: Tbase 4°C, Tupper 27°C for Petroselinum crispum.
crop_parsley.source: Paredes et al. 2025 (ScienceDirect); Elnesr et al. (2013)

crop_parsnip.name: Parsnip
crop_parsnip.notes: Cool-season Apiaceae. Very cold-hardy. Sweetens after frost. Inferred from Apiaceae family (parsley research - Elnesr 2013).
crop_parsnip.source: Apiaceae family classification; same as carrot

crop_pea-tendril.name: Pea Tendril
crop_pea-tendril.notes: Same as peas. Research: Tbase 4.5-5°C, Tupper 27°C for Pisum sativum.
crop_pea-tendril.source: Paredes et al. 2025 (ScienceDirect); Bourgeois et al. (2000)

crop_peas.name: Peas
crop_peas.notes: Cool-season legume. Research: Tbase 4.5-5°C, Tupper 27°C for Pisum sativum.
crop_peas.source: Paredes et al. 2025 (ScienceDirect); Bourgeois et al. (2000); MSU Extension

crop_peonies.name: Peonies
crop_peonies.notes: Cold-hardy perennial. Requires winter chill for flowering. ROUGH ESTIMATE: 30°C upper based on cool-season classification.

crop_pepper.name: Pepper
crop_pepper.notes: OSU Croptime: 11°C lower, 38°C upper threshold for sweet pepper.
crop_pepper.source: OSU Extension Croptime vegetable degree-day models

crop_petunia.name: Petunia
crop_petunia.notes: Warm-season Solanaceae annual. South American origin. Inferred from Solanaceae family (tomatillo/eggplant research).

crop_queen-annes-lace.name: Queen Anne's Lace
crop_queen-annes-lace.notes: Wild carrot (Daucus carota). Same as carrot - Apiaceae. Inferred from Apiaceae family (parsley research - Elnesr 2013).

crop_radicchio.name: Radicchio
crop_radicchio.notes: Cool-season chicory. Same as lettuce family. Cold-hardy. Inferred from Asteraceae family (lettuce research).

crop_radish.name: Radish
crop_radish.notes: Cool-season brassica. Fast-growing. Cold-tolerant. Inferred from brassica family (kale/B. oleracea research).

crop_ranunculus.name: Ranunculus
crop_ranunculus.notes: Cool-season corm. Mediterranean origin. Does not need chilling. ROUGH ESTIMATE: 30°C upper based on cool-season classification.

crop_raspberry.name: Raspberry
crop_raspberry.notes: Temperate perennial. Research: similar to temperate berries. Tbase ~5°C, Tupper ~30°C.
crop_raspberry.source: Paredes et al. 2025 framework; temperate fruit research

crop_rat-tail-radish.name: Rat Tail Radish
crop_rat-tail-radish.notes: Brassica for pods not roots. More heat-tolerant than root radish. Inferred from brassica family (kale/B. oleracea research).

crop_rose.name: Rose
crop_rose.notes: Perennial shrub. Varies by species. Many cold-hardy. ROUGH ESTIMATE: 30°C upper based on cool-season classification.

crop_roselle.name: Roselle (Hibiscus sabdariffa)
crop_roselle.notes: Tropical Malvaceae. Same family as hibiscus. No frost tolerance. ROUGH ESTIMATE: 35°C upper based on warm-season classification.

crop_rosemary.name: Rosemary
crop_rosemary.notes: Mediterranean Lamiaceae. More cold-sensitive than other herbs. Inferred from warm Lamiaceae (basil research - Teles 2023).

crop_rubeckia.name: Rudbeckia (Black-eyed Susan)
crop_rubeckia.notes: Native perennial. Warm-season bloomer. ROUGH ESTIMATE: 35°C upper based on warm-season classification.
crop_rubeckia.source: Inferred from warm-season native flower classification

crop_rutabaga.name: Rutabaga
crop_rutabaga.notes: Cool-season brassica root crop. Very cold-hardy. Inferred from brassica family (kale/B. oleracea research).

crop_sage.name: Sage
crop_sage.notes: Cold-hardy Lamiaceae perennial. Tolerates to -12°C. Inferred from cool Lamiaceae (oregano research - Thanos 1995).

crop_salsola.name: Salsola (Agretti)
crop_salsola.notes: Mediterranean cool-season succulent. Amaranthaceae family. Inferred from cool Amaranthaceae (beet/spinach research).

crop_scabiosa.name: Scabiosa
crop_scabiosa.notes: Cool-season cut flower. Cold-tolerant. ROUGH ESTIMATE: 30°C upper based on cool-season classification.

crop_scallion.name: Scallion
crop_scallion.notes: Cool-season allium. Same as onion family. Inferred from allium family (onion research).

crop_shallots.name: Shallots
crop_shallots.notes: Cool-season allium. Same family as onion and garlic. Inferred from allium family (onion research).

crop_shiso.name: Shiso
crop_shiso.notes: Warm-season Lamiaceae. Related to basil. Frost-sensitive. Inferred from warm Lamiaceae (basil research - Teles 2023).

crop_snapdragons.name: Snapdragons
crop_snapdragons.notes: Cool-season annual. Cold-tolerant. Mediterranean origin. ROUGH ESTIMATE: 30°C upper based on cool-season classification.

crop_sorrel.name: Sorrel
crop_sorrel.notes: Cool-season perennial. Polygonaceae family. Cold-hardy. ROUGH ESTIMATE: 30°C upper based on cool-season classification.

crop_spinach.name: Spinach
crop_spinach.notes: Cool-season. Research: germinates -2.5 to 3°C, Tbase calc -3°C. Germination inhibited above 25-30°C.
crop_spinach.source: HortScience spinach germination research; thermoinhibition studies

crop_squash.name: Squash (Winter)
crop_squash.notes: Warm-season cucurbit. Research: base 8°C, ceiling 32°C for Cucurbita pepo.

crop_stock.name: Stock (Matthiola)
crop_stock.notes: Cool-season brassica flower. Mediterranean origin. Inferred from brassica family (kale/B. oleracea research).

crop_strawberry.name: Strawberry
crop_strawberry.notes: Temperate perennial. Research: similar to temperate berries. Tbase ~5°C, Tupper ~30°C.
crop_strawberry.source: Paredes et al. 2025 framework; temperate fruit research

crop_strawberry-spinach.name: Strawberry Spinach
crop_strawberry-spinach.notes: Chenopodium capitatum. Cool-season Amaranthaceae. Inferred from cool Amaranthaceae (beet/spinach research).

crop_strawflower.name: Strawflower
crop_strawflower.notes: Warm-season annual. Australian origin. ROUGH ESTIMATE: 35°C upper based on warm-season classification.

crop_sudangrass.name: Sudangrass
crop_sudangrass.notes: Warm-season grass. Related to sorghum. Research: Tbase 8-10°C, Tupper 30-34°C.
crop_sudangrass.source: Paredes et al. 2025 (ScienceDirect); Neild and Seeley (1977) - sorghum family

crop_summer-squash.name: Summer Squash
crop_summer-squash.notes: Research uses 8°C base, 32°C ceiling for Cucurbita pepo leaf development.
crop_summer-squash.source: RESEARCH - ScienceDirect thermal time study on summer squash

crop_sunchoke.name: Sunchoke (Jerusalem Artichoke)
crop_sunchoke.notes: Cold-hardy Asteraceae perennial. Native North American. Inferred from Asteraceae family (lettuce research).
crop_sunchoke.source: Inferred from cold-hardy native plant classification

crop_sunflower.name: Sunflower
crop_sunflower.source: Paredes et al. 2025 (ScienceDirect); Todorovic et al. (2009); NDSU Extension

crop_swiss-chard.name: Swiss Chard
crop_swiss-chard.notes: Cool-season. Same species as beet (Beta vulgaris). Research: sugar beet Tbase 2.6-5°C, Tupper 30°C.
crop_swiss-chard.source: Paredes et al. 2025 (ScienceDirect); Jalilian et al. (2005) - sugar beet

crop_talinum.name: Talinum
crop_talinum.notes: Warm-season succulent. Tropical/subtropical origin. ROUGH ESTIMATE: 35°C upper based on warm-season classification.

crop_tarp.name: Tarp
crop_tarp.notes: Not a crop - this is a soil covering/occultation tool.

crop_thyme.name: Thyme
crop_thyme.notes: Cold-hardy Lamiaceae perennial. Tolerates to -7°C or colder. Inferred from cool Lamiaceae (oregano research - Thanos 1995).

crop_tomatillo.name: Tomatillo
crop_tomatillo.notes: Warm-season Solanaceae. Flowers abort below 13°C or above 32°C.

crop_tomato.name: Tomato
crop_tomato.notes: OSU Croptime: 7.2°C lower, 33°C upper. Some sources use 10°C.
crop_tomato.source: OSU Extension Croptime; WIKI cites 10°C for tomato

crop_turnip.name: Turnip
crop_turnip.notes: Cool-season brassica root. Cold-tolerant. Fast-growing. Inferred from brassica family (kale/B. oleracea research).

crop_wisteria.name: Wisteria
crop_wisteria.notes: Cold-hardy deciduous vine. Asian/N.American species. ROUGH ESTIMATE: 30°C upper based on cool-season classification.

crop_yarrow.name: Yarrow
crop_yarrow.notes: Cold-hardy Asteraceae perennial. Native herb. Inferred from Asteraceae family (lettuce research).
crop_yarrow.source: Inferred from cold-hardy native perennial classification

crop_zinnia.name: Zinnia
crop_zinnia.notes: Warm-season annual. Mexican origin. Needs 21°C soil for germination. ROUGH ESTIMATE: 35°C upper based on warm-season classification.
crop_zinnia.source: Inferred from warm-season origin; no specific GDD research
